result.execSummary:
The defendant Rudolph J. Johnas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall have no contact with H.S.-J. dob: 6-6-1980 and C.D.J. dob: 5-2-2013, except as allowed in the paternity action in Lincoln County and at the discretion of the probation agent.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to victim due within 30 days  and must be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence to be served immediately.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rudolph J. Johnas

records.addlTxt: Terminated - regular

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Judge from H.S.J. re: probation condition
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Rudolph J. Johnas in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification complied.  Atty Tlusty makes recommendation.  Mr. Johnas makes statement.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for two years with the following conditions: 30 days county jail with Huber; $100 fine and court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; no contact with H.S.-J. and C.J. except as allowed in the paternity action in Lincoln County at the discretion of the probation agent; Write letter of apology to victim within 30 days pre-approved by the agent; attend counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent. - ba
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-19-2016 09:45 am

Defendant Rudolph J. Johnas in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Housekeeping matters taken care of outside presence of the jury.  Attorney Tlusty requests sequestration of witnesses.  Court orders sequestration of witnesses.  Court goes over parties witness lists.  Recess until 9:00 am.  Reconvene at 9:05 a.m.  Sworn in entire jury panel.  Jury panel selected.  Oath given to selected jury panel.  Brief recess   Opening Statements.  Sworn and examined Officer Robert Horenberger.  Sworn and examined H.S-J.  Recess  H.S-J retakes the stand.  Recess for lunch at 11:45 am   Reconvene at 12:45 pm  H.S-J. retakes the stand.  State rests.  Sworn and examined B.T.  Sworn and examined L.F.  Sworn and examined J.J.  Jury out.  Court questions defendant regarding  his right to testify.  Recess   Outside presence of jury court discusses exhibits with the defendant.  Jury back.   Sworn and examined H.S-J.   Sworn and examined Rudolph Johnas.  Defense rests.  Jury out.  Court goes over jury instructions.  Recess. Court brings jury back at 3:35 p.m.  Court reads jury instructions to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Oath given to bailiff.  Jury out at 4:27 pm  Jury returned with verdict at 4:55 p.m.  Jury finds defendant guilty.  Jury polled by the court.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Court grants judgment on the verdict.  Sentencing to be scheduled at a later date.  - rt
State's requested jury instructions and verdict form

Defendant Rudolph J. Johnas in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed motion to introduce prior incidents.  Mr. Johnas does not object.  Court grants the State's motion. ba

Defendant Rudolph J. Johnas in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Tlusty indicated DE was going to hire an Atty.  DE stated that he will not be hiring an atty and contests charges.  Court sets Jury Trial for December 21, 2015 at 8:30 a.m as #2.  Motion hearing for December 14, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. Court advises DE of right to attorney; DE is freely voluntarily and intelligently proceeding without counsel.  ba

Defendant Rudolph J. Johnas in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was given copy of criminal complaint.  Court informs defendant of charges and penalties.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a bond of $150.00 cash; no contact with H.S.S.-J. - dob:  6-6-1980; defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin for employment purposes.  Pretrial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  - rt

Defendant shall have no contact with H.S.S.-J. - dob:  6-6-1980.  Defendant may leave State of Wisconsin for employment purposes.
